story:
My Medical Mission Trip

This summer the Spring Lake Park High School Emergency Healthcare Program (OEC), that I am a part of, is going to the Dominican Republic on a Medical Mission Trip. While there, we will be assisting at local clinics in providing much needed medical care. 

During this school year I joined the OEC program and will be completing the EMT course leading to my EMT certificate.

1st Place at the MN Youth Emergency Care Competition


The OEC program will be going to the Dominican Republic this summer at the end of July. Since this is a mission trip, each person must pay their own costs for the trip.

What I need to get there?

In order for this trip to become a reality, I will need to raise $1,800. Any donation you make will help me pay for transportation, lodging, food and other essential expenses associated with this mission trip.

Any amount you can contribute will be appreciated and 100% will go to offset trip expenses.

story:
AnyBio was started to help caregivers get access to biometrics for people in their care (kids, adult parents, athletes).

  • AnyBio is a Patent pending wearable device
  • Aggregates data from multiple sensors wirelessly such as a chest strap or a temperature patch. 
  • Combines data with built in impact & environmental sensors
  • Uploads data to cloud using WIFI or Cellular

A user (child, elderly parent, athlete) can wear AnyBio on their arm, around their neck or drop it into their pocket

A caregiver can then monitor this user continuously from anywhere.

AnyBio integrates many external sensors using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technology. In addition, AnyBio has built in impact and environmental sensors. AnyBio allows remote monitoring of the user, by uploading data to the cloud.

User (Child, Elderly Parent, Athlete, Patient) wears AnyBio and other external sensors. He/she does not need to carry a mobile phone.

Caregiver (Parent, Nurse, Coach, Adult Child) can monitor User from anywhere on a mobile dashboard.

AnyBio:

  1. Collects heart rate data wirelessly from a Polar H7/H10 chest strap worn around the chest. Strap purchased separately.
  2. Collects temperature data from a FeverScout temperature patch worn under the arm. FeverScout purchased separately.
  3. Integrates Bluetooth enabled Blood glucose level sensor and additional biometric sensors (to be announced shortly)

 

Uses of AnyBio

AnyBio is great to monitor your child’s body temperature at school. After your child recovers from flu or other illness:

  • Its good to put a temperature patch on your child in case the fever comes back.
  • However, temperature patches work with smartphones, which may not be allowed in school.

With AnyBio:

  • Put on a temperature patch on your child and drop AnyBio into your child’s pocket. AnyBio connects to the patch and provides you temperature reading continuously.
  • It’s rugged design and built in impact sensor keeps track if your child has suffered a fall.

A short video showing how AnyBio can be used on your child is below:

 

AnyBio is an easy to use device if you would like to monitor your elderly parent. With a smartphone carried by your parent:

  • Its not always possible to connect to multiple sensors on your body
  • Smartphones are larger and heavy, and your parent may not always have it on them

With AnyBio, your parent does not need to have a smartphone on him/her. In addition:

  • Your parent can put multiple sensors such as HR strap and Blood glucose monitor.
  • AnyBio connects to these sensors and provides you real time readings.
  • The built in fault detector alerts you if your parent has suffered a fall.

A short video how AnyBio can be used on your parent is shown below:

 

When playing outdoor sports:

  • Your child/athlete is usually too far from the range of your smartphone
  • Your child may not be able to carry a smartphone with them because it may break

AnyBio:

  • Connects to the sensors worn by athlete (such as Heart Rate, Blood glucose)
  • Sends data to your phone via cloud, no matter how far you are from your athlete
  • Built in impact sensor alerts you if there is a significant impact to your athlete
  • Built in environmental sensor allows you to correlate athlete performance with environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity and altitude

Please see a short video on how AnyBio can be used by a soccer parent:

 

When playing sports in a large arena:

  • Your child/athlete is usually too far from the range of your phone
  • He/she can’t carry a mobile phone to connect to the sensors with them because the phone may break

AnyBio:

  • Connects to the sensors worn by athlete (such as Heart Rate, Blood glucose)
  • Sends data to your phone via cloud, no matter how far you are
  • Built in impact sensor alerts you if there is a significant impact
  • Built in environmental sensor allows you to correlate athlete's performance with environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity and altitude

Please see a short video below:

 

Perks

AnyBio currently ships to USA & Canada.  For international shipments, send us a message: Click Here

 

 

Product Details

AnyBio is a patent pending wearable device that aggregates data from other sensors wirelessly such as a chest strap or a wearable temperature patch. 

AnyBio then combines that data with built in impact and environmental sensors and uploads it to the cloud over built in WIFI or Cellular.

The data is displayed on a single mobile dashboard making it easy for a caregiver to monitor remotely.

 

The cellular version is useful when you want to have a device, which would work both, indoors and outdoors. As long as cellular data coverage is available, and a SIM with cellular data plan is inserted into the SD/SIM tray on AnyBio, AnyBio will be able to upload sensor data to the cloud.

 

In the WIFI version, AnyBio uses WIFI to upload sensor data to the cloud. This version is great for locations where WIFI is available such as indoor arenas, hospitals or large homes. Since you use WIFI to upload sensor data to the cloud, you do not need a data plan with AnyBio.

There are many ways to put on AnyBio. AnyBio has mounting options to use with a lanyard, armband or a belt. In addition, AnyBio can be put into a pocket or a pouch, or put on a helmet using harness or an industrial grade adhesive.

 

AnyBio can be worn with external sensors such as heart rate strap, temperature patch and a blood glucose monitor (coming soon). The below table shows the metrics measured by AnyBio when used with a heart rate strap or a temperature patch.

 

Project Timeline

I started AnyBio in May-2016 with an objective to extend the range of the bluetooth low energy (BLE) based sensors, so I could use a smartphone to monitor my son who plays hockey. Over the next several months, I experimented with various high sensitivity BLE devices but could not achieve my objective. The transmit power of the wearable BLE sensors was very low and BLE sensors at longer distances needed line of sight to work, which is not always practical. In October, 2016, I decided to abandon that approach and decided to create the current version of AnyBio which solves this BLE range issue in addition to allowing multiple BLE sensors to be connected simultaneously.

After the completion of the crowdfunding campaign, I plan integrate the main circuit board with the case, and start working on additional software features as well as native mobile application. In parallel, I will take the  product through FCC compliance.

Funds collected through crowdfunding campaign will be used to support costs for:

  • Main circuit board and case volume production
  • FCC compliance
  • Software Feature Development on AnyBio device and cloud.
  • Native mobile application development for IOS and Android

 

Prototype

At AnyBio, I have implemented a working prototype of our product.

  • The prototype comprises a number of breakout boards, which implement full functionality of all the sensors built into AnyBio.
  • I have also fully tested the Bluetooth and cloud interfaces, which are used to collect data from external sensors and then upload this information in real time to the cloud (usually within 1 sec – subject to network delays).
  • I have implemented a basic web dashboard to collect and display sensor data from the cloud.
  • I have also designed the production case for AnyBio. A prototype of the case is also shown in the picture below

AnyBio can be worn in a number of different ways. You can drop it into your pocket, put it on your arm or mount it on your helmet. 

In the AnyBio prototype video:

  • The breakout board is connected to a computer using a USB cable, which allows us to see all the sensor readings that the AnyBio breakout is collecting.
  • In the prototype video, you can see the same readings are being collected by our backend software, which runs on Amazon cloud service.
  • Finally, you can also see those sensor readings being displayed on a mobile phone in real time.

A short video of the AnyBio prototype is below:

The design of AnyBio went through several iterations before we arrived at the final design.  An early version of AnyBio was produced in a glossy white finish. While aesthetically, glossy white finish did look great, the status LED’s contrast much better with a product with black finish.

A 3D drawing showing dimensions of AnyBio is below:

I also experimented with building in a wrist heart rate monitor into AnyBio. A breakout board for an optical heart rate monitor, which we integrated with AnyBio, is shown below. What I found is that Optical wrist based heart rate sensors are not as accurate as the heart rate chest strap from companies such as Polar and Garmin. In addition, mounting on wrist does not work for all scenarios especially if you are playing a contact sport.

At AnyBio, I also experimented with using long range Bluetooth technology to extend the range of Bluetooth based sensors. A USB breakout to implement this prototype is pictured above (center). I decided to abandon this approach because most wearable Bluetooth (BLE) sensors transmit at low power to enhance battery life, which really limits the range of these sensors. In addition, at longer distances, BLE requires line of sight for sensors to connect.

 

Starting AnyBio

My Linkedin Profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanjay-gupta-88b2aa

I started AnyBio in May 2016 after my son, who plays soccer and ice hockey, fell sick and was diagnosed with a heart condition. While my son was recovering, I wanted to monitor his heart rate and body temperature when he was at school or playing soccer & hockey. While there were individual sensors available, I could not find any product that aggregated multiple sensors, was small/rugged enough to be worn during sports, and could work without a smartphone.

Since I could not find something that worked for me, I decided to create one over the summer. What started as a summer project gradually grew in scope after I got interest on using the product not only to monitor children, but also their elderly parents.

 

Prior to AnyBio, I have been at two successful startups where I was one of the first few engineers – Trillium (acquired by Intel for $300M) and Ramp Networks (acquired by Nokia for $127M). I am an electrical engineer with expertise in embedded devices. I have personally designed the hardware and implemented all the software for AnyBio’s sensor aggregator. I am passionate about health and fitness and a proud hockey parent.

At AnyBio, my colleague Don Chin (pictured in the middle of the right pic) is helping me with the launch of our crowdfunding campaign. Don is an accomplished marketer for technology products and also a member of Screen Actor’s Guild (SAG). He has produced hundreds of short films for corporate and philanthropic clients. Like me, he has a long career working in the technology sector for large and small companies in Silicon Valley, and has worked in marketing and operations for several successful startups.

 

Risks & Challenges

While I have developed a fully functioning prototype and tested most software that goes on AnyBio, AnyBio venture is still a start up and comes with potential risks and challenges faced by any startup. I will try my best to fulfill rewards that I have promised. I also value transparency above all else and will make sure to always keep my backers up to date on all changes to the estimated timelines. Here are some risks to keep in mind when backing a hardware product venture like AnyBio:

Manufacturing Risks

Although I have substantial experience in manufacturing having worked at the first and the leading contract manufacturer of its time (Solectron), any new product has the potential to have delays. I have tried to account for these delays in the estimated timelines.

Additional Risks

There are likely other small risks and hurdles that I haven't even thought of yet that will be discovered along the way towards fulfilling this project. My main objective is to make this project successful as efficiently as possible and keep everyone in the loop with diligent communication and an open dialogue with my backers.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if AnyBio may not be the product for you, you can help by spreading the word. You can:

  • Like us on Facebook, please click here. If you share AnyBio page with your Facebook contacts, that will be much appreciated.
  • Utilize Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about AnyBio
  • If you would like to partner or invest in AnyBio, please email us: info@anybio.com

 

I really appreciate your support. Thank you!
story_txt:
AnyBio was started to help caregivers get access to biometrics for people in their care (kids, adult parents, athletes).

AnyBio is a Patent pending wearable device
Aggregates data from multiple sensors wirelessly such as a chest strap or a temperature patch. 
Combines data with built in impact & environmental sensors
Uploads data to cloud using WIFI or Cellular


A user (child, elderly parent, athlete) can wear AnyBio on their arm, around their neck or drop it into their pocket
A caregiver can then monitor this user continuously from anywhere.

AnyBio integrates many external sensors using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) technology. In addition, AnyBio has built in impact and environmental sensors. AnyBio allows remote monitoring of the user, by uploading data to the cloud.

User (Child, Elderly Parent, Athlete, Patient) wears AnyBio and other external sensors. He/she does not need to carry a mobile phone.
Caregiver (Parent, Nurse, Coach, Adult Child) can monitor User from anywhere on a mobile dashboard.

AnyBio:

Collects heart rate data wirelessly from a Polar H7/H10 chest strap worn around the chest. Strap purchased separately.
Collects temperature data from a FeverScout temperature patch worn under the arm. FeverScout purchased separately.
Integrates Bluetooth enabled Blood glucose level sensor and additional biometric sensors (to be announced shortly)

 
Uses of AnyBio

AnyBio is great to monitor your child’s body temperature at school. After your child recovers from flu or other illness:

Its good to put a temperature patch on your child in case the fever comes back.
However, temperature patches work with smartphones, which may not be allowed in school.


With AnyBio:

Put on a temperature patch on your child and drop AnyBio into your child’s pocket. AnyBio connects to the patch and provides you temperature reading continuously.
It’s rugged design and built in impact sensor keeps track if your child has suffered a fall.

A short video showing how AnyBio can be used on your child is below:


 


AnyBio is an easy to use device if you would like to monitor your elderly parent. With a smartphone carried by your parent:

Its not always possible to connect to multiple sensors on your body
Smartphones are larger and heavy, and your parent may not always have it on them


With AnyBio, your parent does not need to have a smartphone on him/her. In addition:

Your parent can put multiple sensors such as HR strap and Blood glucose monitor.
AnyBio connects to these sensors and provides you real time readings.
The built in fault detector alerts you if your parent has suffered a fall.

A short video how AnyBio can be used on your parent is shown below:

 

When playing outdoor sports:

Your child/athlete is usually too far from the range of your smartphone
Your child may not be able to carry a smartphone with them because it may break


AnyBio:

Connects to the sensors worn by athlete (such as Heart Rate, Blood glucose)
Sends data to your phone via cloud, no matter how far you are from your athlete
Built in impact sensor alerts you if there is a significant impact to your athlete
Built in environmental sensor allows you to correlate athlete performance with environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity and altitude

Please see a short video on how AnyBio can be used by a soccer parent:

 

When playing sports in a large arena:

Your child/athlete is usually too far from the range of your phone
He/she can’t carry a mobile phone to connect to the sensors with them because the phone may break


AnyBio:

Connects to the sensors worn by athlete (such as Heart Rate, Blood glucose)
Sends data to your phone via cloud, no matter how far you are
Built in impact sensor alerts you if there is a significant impact
Built in environmental sensor allows you to correlate athlete's performance with environmental conditions such as temperature, humidity and altitude

Please see a short video below:

 
Perks
AnyBio currently ships to USA & Canada.  For international shipments, send us a message: Click Here

 

 
Product Details
AnyBio is a patent pending wearable device that aggregates data from other sensors wirelessly such as a chest strap or a wearable temperature patch. 
AnyBio then combines that data with built in impact and environmental sensors and uploads it to the cloud over built in WIFI or Cellular.
The data is displayed on a single mobile dashboard making it easy for a caregiver to monitor remotely.

 

The cellular version is useful when you want to have a device, which would work both, indoors and outdoors. As long as cellular data coverage is available, and a SIM with cellular data plan is inserted into the SD/SIM tray on AnyBio, AnyBio will be able to upload sensor data to the cloud.
 

In the WIFI version, AnyBio uses WIFI to upload sensor data to the cloud. This version is great for locations where WIFI is available such as indoor arenas, hospitals or large homes. Since you use WIFI to upload sensor data to the cloud, you do not need a data plan with AnyBio.

There are many ways to put on AnyBio. AnyBio has mounting options to use with a lanyard, armband or a belt. In addition, AnyBio can be put into a pocket or a pouch, or put on a helmet using harness or an industrial grade adhesive.

 




AnyBio can be worn with external sensors such as heart rate strap, temperature patch and a blood glucose monitor (coming soon). The below table shows the metrics measured by AnyBio when used with a heart rate strap or a temperature patch.




 
Project Timeline
I started AnyBio in May-2016 with an objective to extend the range of the bluetooth low energy (BLE) based sensors, so I could use a smartphone to monitor my son who plays hockey. Over the next several months, I experimented with various high sensitivity BLE devices but could not achieve my objective. The transmit power of the wearable BLE sensors was very low and BLE sensors at longer distances needed line of sight to work, which is not always practical. In October, 2016, I decided to abandon that approach and decided to create the current version of AnyBio which solves this BLE range issue in addition to allowing multiple BLE sensors to be connected simultaneously.

After the completion of the crowdfunding campaign, I plan integrate the main circuit board with the case, and start working on additional software features as well as native mobile application. In parallel, I will take the  product through FCC compliance.

Funds collected through crowdfunding campaign will be used to support costs for:

Main circuit board and case volume production
FCC compliance
Software Feature Development on AnyBio device and cloud.
Native mobile application development for IOS and Android

 
Prototype
At AnyBio, I have implemented a working prototype of our product.

The prototype comprises a number of breakout boards, which implement full functionality of all the sensors built into AnyBio.
I have also fully tested the Bluetooth and cloud interfaces, which are used to collect data from external sensors and then upload this information in real time to the cloud (usually within 1 sec – subject to network delays).
I have implemented a basic web dashboard to collect and display sensor data from the cloud.
I have also designed the production case for AnyBio. A prototype of the case is also shown in the picture below


AnyBio can be worn in a number of different ways. You can drop it into your pocket, put it on your arm or mount it on your helmet. 

In the AnyBio prototype video:

The breakout board is connected to a computer using a USB cable, which allows us to see all the sensor readings that the AnyBio breakout is collecting.
In the prototype video, you can see the same readings are being collected by our backend software, which runs on Amazon cloud service.
Finally, you can also see those sensor readings being displayed on a mobile phone in real time.

A short video of the AnyBio prototype is below:

The design of AnyBio went through several iterations before we arrived at the final design.  An early version of AnyBio was produced in a glossy white finish. While aesthetically, glossy white finish did look great, the status LED’s contrast much better with a product with black finish.
A 3D drawing showing dimensions of AnyBio is below:

I also experimented with building in a wrist heart rate monitor into AnyBio. A breakout board for an optical heart rate monitor, which we integrated with AnyBio, is shown below. What I found is that Optical wrist based heart rate sensors are not as accurate as the heart rate chest strap from companies such as Polar and Garmin. In addition, mounting on wrist does not work for all scenarios especially if you are playing a contact sport.

At AnyBio, I also experimented with using long range Bluetooth technology to extend the range of Bluetooth based sensors. A USB breakout to implement this prototype is pictured above (center). I decided to abandon this approach because most wearable Bluetooth (BLE) sensors transmit at low power to enhance battery life, which really limits the range of these sensors. In addition, at longer distances, BLE requires line of sight for sensors to connect.
 
Starting AnyBio

My Linkedin Profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/sanjay-gupta-88b2aa
I started AnyBio in May 2016 after my son, who plays soccer and ice hockey, fell sick and was diagnosed with a heart condition. While my son was recovering, I wanted to monitor his heart rate and body temperature when he was at school or playing soccer & hockey. While there were individual sensors available, I could not find any product that aggregated multiple sensors, was small/rugged enough to be worn during sports, and could work without a smartphone.

Since I could not find something that worked for me, I decided to create one over the summer. What started as a summer project gradually grew in scope after I got interest on using the product not only to monitor children, but also their elderly parents.
 
Prior to AnyBio, I have been at two successful startups where I was one of the first few engineers – Trillium (acquired by Intel for $300M) and Ramp Networks (acquired by Nokia for $127M). I am an electrical engineer with expertise in embedded devices. I have personally designed the hardware and implemented all the software for AnyBio’s sensor aggregator. I am passionate about health and fitness and a proud hockey parent.
At AnyBio, my colleague Don Chin (pictured in the middle of the right pic) is helping me with the launch of our crowdfunding campaign. Don is an accomplished marketer for technology products and also a member of Screen Actor’s Guild (SAG). He has produced hundreds of short films for corporate and philanthropic clients. Like me, he has a long career working in the technology sector for large and small companies in Silicon Valley, and has worked in marketing and operations for several successful startups.
 
Risks & Challenges
While I have developed a fully functioning prototype and tested most software that goes on AnyBio, AnyBio venture is still a start up and comes with potential risks and challenges faced by any startup. I will try my best to fulfill rewards that I have promised. I also value transparency above all else and will make sure to always keep my backers up to date on all changes to the estimated timelines. Here are some risks to keep in mind when backing a hardware product venture like AnyBio:
Manufacturing Risks
Although I have substantial experience in manufacturing having worked at the first and the leading contract manufacturer of its time (Solectron), any new product has the potential to have delays. I have tried to account for these delays in the estimated timelines.
Additional Risks
There are likely other small risks and hurdles that I haven't even thought of yet that will be discovered along the way towards fulfilling this project. My main objective is to make this project successful as efficiently as possible and keep everyone in the loop with diligent communication and an open dialogue with my backers.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Even if AnyBio may not be the product for you, you can help by spreading the word. You can:

Like us on Facebook, please click here. If you share AnyBio page with your Facebook contacts, that will be much appreciated.
Utilize Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about AnyBio
If you would like to partner or invest in AnyBio, please email us: info@anybio.com

 
I really appreciate your support. Thank you!

story:
Coming fall 2018 to the iOS App Store

Looma is the first app for meal planning & prep to work the way you do. There's no information overload or diet rules to follow as you focus on the shopping, cooking, and eating more efficiently and effectively than ever before. Looma prepares grocery lists, perfectly portions recipes for multiple meals, and tracks nutrition automatically. There are never cravings for flavor from starving, dieting, or depriving as you'll discover a variety of recipes that intuitively adapt to your favorite flavors with every swipe and keep the inspiration in your kitchen. 

Powered by Yummly’s recipe engine, Looma contains over 2 million recipes aggregated from across the web and 10 billion+ data points to deliver highly personalized recipes. 

  1. Make a profile in minutes to set your calories and macros according to your current body composition and goals while each recipe follows your dietary preferences, like vegan, gluten-free, or dairy-free.
  2. Discover fresh new options by swiping a selection of recipes, modified to any serving size.
  3. Looma gives recipe directions, personal shopping lists, and tracks calories and macronutrients automatically.

You'll have free time and flexibility with the app that's uncompromisingly designed around helping you prepare meals made just for you. With Looma, it no longer takes the effort to eliminate leftover food waste and eat a variety of healthy foods that match your every expectation. It's never been easier to configure a healthy meal plan; now with just a swipe.

Through the labor of love, bringing Looma to where it is today has been a long and challenging journey. We're in the final stages of development, but now we need your help to bring Looma fully to life.

The money raised on Indiegogo will go directly towards third-party services, expanding our team and contracted expertise, and completion of the app.

Years in the making, and leaving no stone unturned, we have meticulously considered every functional and aesthetic detail of Looma.

Together by interviewing knowledgeable nutritionists, innovative meal preppers, and many self-taught cooks we’ve created a solution that will put an end to all your hesitations about creating your homemade meals. You can trust that your food will be tasteful yet nutritious while you prepare it in no time at all.

We're a team of developers and designers with the goal of inspiring healthy lifestyles through simple design and data-driven personalization. Meeting as students at Michigan Tech, Chetan and Kyle created Looma to make healthy lifestyles more sustainable. Now, Chetan works in Green Bay, Wisconsin after graduating with his computer science degree in 3 years and Kyle will graduate this spring from computer engineering to work in Palo Alto, California.

Take a look at the rewards we provided for you live better and show you've been a part of the journey. Every product order comes with an Indiegogo exclusive 1.94" x 3" Looma dye-cut sticker made from durable vinyl and laminate that protects against rain, sunlight, and scratching; perfect for sleek items you carry into the rugged outdoors.

9&10 News - The Four / Longevity Network / Nibletz / Traverse City Record Eagle / WJMN Local 3 / The Daily Mining Gazette / FOX UP & NBC TV6

Interested in writing about us? Our press kit is available for download here. Please, feel free to email us directly at hello@livelooma.com or ask us a question above.

Share on Facebook / Share on Twitter / Share on Pinterest / Share on LinkedIn / Email a friend

Video by Ben Jaszczak, Still North Media

Drone footage by Aaron Kostrzewa, AirMax Aerial

Music by Nick Cecconi

Voiceover by Alec Lobrano, Paris-based culinary writer & author of Hungry for Paris

Acting by Courtney Meyer & Kyle Hannah

 

Expenses

We believe in making our costs transparent and will continue to cover the costs of the services we have used in development - we're asking for your help to get access to the data we need to bring Looma to life. Here's a breakdown of how your contribution now can make a difference.

BETA TESTING EXPENSES
Access to 2+ million recipes.....$500/mo (up to 3 months of testing)

Devices for development & testing (refurbished)

  • iPhone 7..............................$350
  • iPhone 8..............................$700
  • iPhone X..............................$990
  • iMac.....................................$1,200

FIRST MONTH EXPENSES
Access to 2+ million recipes.....$5,000/mo

 

Risks and Challenges

Our primary reason for launching on Indiegogo was to gain feedback on your most desired features for the app. Although we have nearly completed our first prototype and outlined the features for the final app, we are uncompromising on quality. Up to three months additional time may be needed to develop additional features. Should any issues arise, we'll keep you updated every step of the way.

We will be using Test Flight by Apple for beta access to the app before the release. It is limited to 10,000 users for up to 90 days. In the case, we reach this amount of unique signups during this Indiegogo campaign, only the first 10,000 people may be accepted. However, the discounted subscription code you receive may still be applied at any time once the app is made public during the release in November.

Learn more about the Indiegogo terms of use

story:
Who we are
  We are Lee and Glenn Perry of Samadhi Tank Company, and our goal is to bring the finest personal floatation device into the homes of thousands of people, spreading the benefits of floating across the globe.
  Since 1972, we have led the float tank industry in designing and manufacturing the highest quality floatation tanks. We know more about floating than anyone else in the world - in fact we helped invent it! It has been our love and passion for over 45 years and we’re thrilled to have a new reason to connect with you.

  In 1973 we started offering floating out of our home, and in 1979 we opened the very first
commercial floatation tank center in Los Angeles. We have supplied or supported the design, construction and operation of over dozens of centers throughout the world; from Brazil to Kazakhstan.

 

The Samadhi Tank@Home
  This is the culmination of our 40+ years of experience in the float industry. Everything we've learned has been integrated into a design that is affordable, reliable, distraction free, easy to operate and perfect for delivering all the benefits of floating right in your very own home.
  Experience an environment of vast emptiness and unknown boundaries.

Affordability
  The Tank@Home is the most affordable tank on the market including purchase plus operating costs. One distinguishing feature of the Samadhi Tank@Home is our high-quality insulation that conserves energy, significantly lowering your monthly utility bills and reduces airborne noise.

Reliability
  We have not found any company that makes heaters reliable and high quality enough to meet our strict standards so we have designed our own foolproof heater and control which will last for many, many, many years of carefree use. The control has an amazing industry-leading accuracy. Our owners really appreciate this.

Specifications
Tank length: 95.5"
Tank width: 47.5"
Space in front to open door: 20"
Length including space to open door 120.5"
Color: black

Upgrades:

Highly recommended: Condensation free option $599
  All tanks can have interior dripping from the roof which may disturb your float. If it is not handled, it will drip on you and disturb you float. This prevents that.

External filtration system $1790
  The filtration system supplied sits outside and is placed inside when it is time to filter. The external version replaces that and is connected to the back and only requires being turned on. So it is more aesthetic and convenient.

Ultraviolet system $929
  Without this option 35% Hydrogen Peroxide is required in the filtration process. This option helps with sanitation and cuts down on the use of 35%HP.

Speakers $550
  Built in speakers for those wanting sound.

The Samadhi Tank@Home is shipped without Epsom Salt and shipping cost is based on zip code.

 

What We Need & What You Get
  The purpose of this campaign is to replenish the extensive R&D investment we made in developing The Samadhi Tank@Home and to buy the materials necessary to produce our first bulk run of tanks while ramping up our marketing campaign. Our goal is $100,000.
  In exchange for your support we are excited to offer you discounts on some of our products plus unique rewards including one-of- a-kind memorabilia from the formation of the float industry.

The Impact
  The incessant demands of today's always-on, always-connected world have increased the need for carving out time and space for contemplation and concentration. Rather than take this opportunity once or twice a month, Samadhi Tank@Home makes this experience available when and where you need it - even on a daily basis, right in your own home or workplace.

  Our mentor, Dr. John C. Lilly, consciousness and dolphin researcher, taught that to raise consciousness in a float environment, it is important to remove distractions. The Samadhi Tank@Home, like all Samadhi Tanks, has zero distractions. Floating is a spark in your development of an empty mind, an open heart, and an increased ability to function at a higher level. Free yourself from the current expectations and demands anytime you want, in your own Tank@Home.

 

Risks & Challenges

We realized that most other inexpensive tanks use no insulation. This results in them costing over $1500 per year just to keep heated. In four years of use that comes out to more than $6000. We are very concerned about the carbon footprint of our tanks so our challenge was to make them as inexpensive to operate as possible. We have done a great job. In a cold environment of 56ºF or 13ºC it costs less than $18 / month for us here, to keep the tank heated.
  After testing prototypes we are delighted with our final model. For 20 years our team has been refining production practices. We are also now using computer controlled machinery (CNCs) that allow complete accuracy.
  Shipping times will be specified in the perk descriptions. Normally we ship 4 weeks from the time of an order. We expect to be able to do that soon. Our recent challenge has been getting our product out in front of the right audience, and that’s why we’re here on Indiegogo - to introduce to the world of crowd funding and social media the newest Time Machine to the Present® - The Samadhi Tank@Home.

 

You Can Help
  John said, “It is my firm belief that the experience of higher states of consciousness is necessary for survival of the human species.” You can become a part of this evolutionary wave of compassion before it’s too late.
  Not ready for your own Tank@Home? Acquire a perk. Tell everyone you know about the Samadhi Tank@Home. The more people who float, the better world we will live in. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word.

 

Frequently Asked Questions

What is Floating?
  You lie face up in 10” of Epsom salt solution in a floatation tank, and the amount of Epsom salt added to the solution makes it so heavy that you seem to defy gravity and float like an astronaut floating in space. You can leave the door open, or if you want to get rid of the distractions of noise and light you can close the door. This allows you to concentrate on or contemplate about yourself or whatever you want.
  Socrates said “Know Thyself”. Floating allows you to do this better than anywhere else. Though it may not be for everyone, for those who do it, floating can be transformative.

If floating is so incredible, how come everyone isn’t doing it?
  Many people are afraid of being with themselves. This partly is from people thinking the tank must be used in a particular way and they don’t know what that is. We let people know the way to use the tank is however they are comfortable. They can have the door open, light on, getting in and out whenever they want, different body positions and stretches. They are in control of their float and can make themselves comfortable.
  If they decide to open up to the possibilities available from floating, they can move out of their mind and mental chatter and into a higher state of consciousness and functionality.
  Our tanks provide the best possible environment for exploring the extraordinary silence and stillness of floating, and we’re excited to share the most affordable, distraction free float experience in the comfort of your very own home - introducing the Samadhi Tank@Home.

Does the tank come with Epsom salt?
  No, but we are happy to help you find a distributor near you to meet your needs.

How much is shipping?
  Shipping is not included and your rate will be based on your zip code.

What happens to your money if we don't reach the goal?
  Every little bit helps. So, if you've donated, your money will still go towards offsetting the costs we've outlined. You'll still be a part of the creation of a really great show.

One distinguishing feature of the Samadhi Tank@Home is our high-quality insulation that conserves energy, significantly lowering your monthly utility bills and reduces airborne noise.Reliability  We have not found any company that makes heaters reliable and high quality enough to meet our strict standards so we have designed our own foolproof heater and control which will last for many, many, many years of carefree use. The control has an amazing industry-leading accuracy. Our owners really appreciate this.SpecificationsTank length: 95.5"Tank width: 47.5"Space in front to open door: 20"Length including space to open door 120.5"Color: blackUpgrades:Highly recommended: Condensation free option $599  All tanks can have interior dripping from the roof which may disturb your float. If it is not handled, it will drip on you and disturb you float. This prevents that.External filtration system $1790  The filtration system supplied sits outside and is placed inside when it is time to filter. The external version replaces that and is connected to the back and only requires being turned on. So it is more aesthetic and convenient.Ultraviolet system $929  Without this option 35% Hydrogen Peroxide is required in the filtration process. This option helps with sanitation and cuts down on the use of 35%HP.Speakers $550  Built in speakers for those wanting sound.The Samadhi Tank@Home is shipped without Epsom Salt and shipping cost is based on zip code. What We Need & What You Get  The purpose of this campaign is to replenish the extensive R&D investment we made in developing The Samadhi Tank@Home and to buy the materials necessary to produce our first bulk run of tanks while ramping up our marketing campaign. Our goal is $100,000.  In exchange for your support we are excited to offer you discounts on some of our products plus unique rewards including one-of- a-kind memorabilia from the formation of the float industry.The Impact  The incessant demands of today's always-on, always-connected world have increased the need for carving out time and space for contemplation and concentration. Rather than take this opportunity once or twice a month, Samadhi Tank@Home makes this experience available when and where you need it - even on a daily basis, right in your own home or workplace.  Our mentor, Dr. John C. Lilly, consciousness and dolphin researcher, taught that to raise consciousness in a float environment, it is important to remove distractions. The Samadhi Tank@Home, like all Samadhi Tanks, has zero distractions. Floating is a spark in your development of an empty mind, an open heart, and an increased ability to function at a higher level. Free yourself from the current expectations and demands anytime you want, in your own Tank@Home. Risks & ChallengesWe realized that most other inexpensive tanks use no insulation. This results in them costing over $1500 per year just to keep heated. In four years of use that comes out to more than $6000. We are very concerned about the carbon footprint of our tanks so our challenge was to make them as inexpensive to operate as possible. We have done a great job. In a cold environment of 56ºF or 13ºC it costs less than $18 / month for us here, to keep the tank heated.  After testing prototypes we are delighted with our final model. For 20 years our team has been refining production practices. We are also now using computer controlled machinery (CNCs) that allow complete accuracy.  Shipping times will be specified in the perk descriptions. Normally we ship 4 weeks from the time of an order. We expect to be able to do that soon. Our recent challenge has been getting our product out in front of the right audience, and that’s why we’re here on Indiegogo - to introduce to the world of crowd funding and social media the newest Time Machine to the Present® - The Samadhi Tank@Home. You Can Help  John said, “It is my firm belief that the experience of higher states of consciousness is necessary for survival of the human species.” You can become a part of this evolutionary wave of compassion before it’s too late.  Not ready for your own Tank@Home? Acquire a perk. Tell everyone you know about the Samadhi Tank@Home. The more people who float, the better world we will live in. Use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word. Frequently Asked QuestionsWhat is Floating?  You lie face up in 10” of Epsom salt solution in a floatation tank, and the amount of Epsom salt added to the solution makes it so heavy that you seem to defy gravity and float like an astronaut floating in space. You can leave the door open, or if you want to get rid of the distractions of noise and light you can close the door. This allows you to concentrate on or contemplate about yourself or whatever you want.  Socrates said “Know Thyself”. Floating allows you to do this better than anywhere else. Though it may not be for everyone, for those who do it, floating can be transformative.If floating is so incredible, how come everyone isn’t doing it?  Many people are afraid of being with themselves. This partly is from people thinking the tank must be used in a particular way and they don’t know what that is. We let people know the way to use the tank is however they are comfortable. They can have the door open, light on, getting in and out whenever they want, different body positions and stretches. They are in control of their float and can make themselves comfortable.  If they decide to open up to the possibilities available from floating, they can move out of their mind and mental chatter and into a higher state of consciousness and functionality.  Our tanks provide the best possible environment for exploring the extraordinary silence and stillness of floating, and we’re excited to share the most affordable, distraction free float experience in the comfort of your very own home - introducing the Samadhi Tank@Home.Does the tank come with Epsom salt?  No, but we are happy to help you find a distributor near you to meet your needs.How much is shipping?  Shipping is not included and your rate will be based on your zip code.What happens to your money if we don't reach the goal?  Every little bit helps. So, if you've donated, your money will still go towards offsetting the costs we've outlined. You'll still be a part of the creation of a really great show.

story:
Jozi-Berlin is an epic solo adventure that will see me – Max Lehr – travel from Johannesburg, South Africa all the way to Berlin, Germany, in a slightly modified 1999 VW Polo Playa.

The reasons for the madness are varied, but the primary goal is to help those who cannot access fresh water. Millions of people struggle without potable water, while the rest of us throw it away, oblivious.

As a musician, photographer and new-born explorer, I have decided to raise awareness, distribute LifeStraws and try to right the wrongs that so many people face by undertaking an adventure that defies belief. Travelling alone, I will capture the narrative of everyone I meet through my photography while helping to bring much-needed aid.

All I need to make this amazing journey real is your help. Just a few dollars goes a huge way in Africa, and every contribution will be used to help people who will never be able to thank you enough.

story:
Philosophy

LIVE.WHOLE.YOGA 

Who We Are?

Founded by Nutritionist Dayne Crocker and Yoga Teacher Crystal King whom both come from an extensive health & wellness background. Our brand was born after years of extensive work both nationally & internationally specializing in Nutrition, Yoga, Sustainability and philanthropy.

Why are Live Whole Yoga Mats Environmental?

The live whole yoga mat is a 100% chemical free innovation that is biodegradable, fair-trade, sustainable & made from organic resources. Our mats are manufactured with love in Sri Lanka where all of the mats compounds are farmed, harvested & processed in a sustainable & fair way that is in line with our core values. Our mats are made from durable natural tree rubber & reinforced with coconut coir fibre making them perfect for not only your yoga practice, a home gym flooring solution or a simple non toxic play area for your children. Our mats are not only recyclable but can be planted in the garden at the end of their lives. 

Mat Features:

  • Thickness: 3mm
  • Length: 183cm (72")
  • Width: 61cm (24")
  • Weight: 2.8kg

Our Ethos?

We believe that by making conscious purchases we will be the generation to pioneer a global movement of sustainability & insure the protection of Mother Earth for generations to come. How do we do this? From every Live Whole Yoga purchase we donate part of our profits to buying back land for conservation which is powered by Rainforest Trust. Why Rainforest Trust? They donate 100% of their contributions to their campaigns & only use a small percentage for marketing and administration costs. 

Our Vision?

By funding our campaign you are actively participating in our mission to create a 100% conscious brand in the global marketplace that will be the leaders in innovation of sustainable, chemical free, biodegradable & functional products that are made with integrity and in line with Live Whole Yoga's core values. Together with your contribution we will be the change we want to see in the world & that change begins here through the creation of everyday products that are made with mother nature as our first priority. 

What you will be apart of:

Help us Reach $10,000. We are here and ready to GOGO with our mother earth loving yoga mats. We need your help to gain our first shipment & get the world pumped to create this global movement by creating a solid marketing campaign which will insure our message is heard loud & clear from the tops of every mountain on Mother Earth. 
We Need:
  • To pay for our launch & marketing campaign which will be powered by Filtered Media. this will give our brand the opportunity to leverage of global brands like Vitamix, Synergy Natural & through various print media editorials. 
  • Your contribution from this campaign will allow us to pay for our first shipment upfront & give us the opportunity to have our mats stocked by a global distributor.
  •  You will be the first to contribute to our one for one campaign in buying back land for conservation with Rainforest Trust. 
  • photography & filming for our marketing. 
  • To expand our range of mats to large at home workout squares, commercial gym flooring solutions and at home kids play/stretch areas. 
Perks:
Your $60.00 contribution will give you your very own Live Whole Yoga Mat & be among the first eco warriors to contribute to our global mission of buying back land for conservation. 
Your $100.00 contribution will give you x2 Live Whole Yoga Mats & will be saving natural habitats all over the globe from deforestation. 
Our first shipment will be here by the first week in September & our mats will RRP at $89.00 AUD. Free shipping within Australia.

The Impact

As the popularity of Yoga has increased so has the demand for yoga mats. Yoga is a spiritual practice & traditionally was practiced on woven mats which are made from various natural resources like coconut. 
In the modern day yoga mats have become a natural disaster as they are made from all types of harmful chemical compounds like PVC which go into landfill and contribute to the devastation of mother nature. Imagine how this could be affecting your health whilst getting hot and sweaty on your yoga mat. 
What is PVC?
PVC is a man made (Polyvinyl Chloride) oil based PLASTIC! Research into this plastic and its manufacturing found that PVC & the plasticisers used to soften the product are toxic and studies have linked these products with cancer, hormonal disruption & dioxin production. PVC is extremely difficult to dispose or recycle & usually requires incineration which releases toxins into the environment. 
Whats on the market?
There are so many "ECO" YOGA mats on the market that are still filled with chemicals, like TPE, PVC & Plastic. These mats are not biodegradable & mass produced in sweat shops all over the world. For these reasons we have created the Live Whole Yoga mat & can stand proud knowing that our mats are made with 100% integrity & will last for many years before going back into the ground to feed mother earth. 
What is Natural Tree Rubber? 
Natural rubber comes from the rubber tree. Our tree rubber is harvested from live trees at plantations in Sri Lanka. The harvesting process is sustainable and the resource renewable. The end products are biodegradable and can be recycled and reused again and again. There is no toxic by-products from the manufacturing of natural rubber mats.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you financially can't help but have a voice please share our campaign & please donate to Rainforest Trust to help educate the world on building a global movement for a sustainable tomorrow.

Many Thanks & Namaste

story:
What’s MyChi


MyChi is your personal sleep doctor. It not only tells your sleep status, but also analyzes your sleep patterns, finds the causes of your sleeplessness, and provides tailored advice on how to improve sleep and well-being.

MyChi applies TCM Meridian Organ Clock Theory* to identify your body’s weaknesses and imbalances that bother your sleep, turning this into actionable daily advice on custom lifestyle advice, Food Therapy recommendations, Acupressure guidance, and seasonal lifestyle tips to improve your sleep and overall health.


What's Inside



Media Coverage



Msn:   MyChi Personal Food Therapy Smart Assistant Powered by Ancient Wisdom and Modern Tech

Technode: Instead of just offering dry data as most current smart hardware makers were doing, MyChi and then translates these into actionable food therapy recommendations, exercises and alternative health suggestions

Thats Shanghai: The new age techie



MyChi In Your Daily Life


MyChi is easy to use. You don’t need to wear it. Just place it under your pillow before bed. MyChi records your sleeping and waking habits.

Every morning you get a list of advice for the day on food therapy, exercise and acupressure right on your smart phone. The app is a full-service guide to a healthy lifestyle with an innovative mix of modern science and ancient wisdom.

Don’t know how to cook? MyChi provides more than 1000 Food Therapy recipes and step by step guide. Most of the recipes take under 30 minutes so you don’t need to worry about food preparation in your busy life.

Don’t know which dish to order when eating out? MyChi helps you to choose the right dishes suitable for you.

MyChi provides all kinds of exercises, in which traditional sport activities such as Taijiquan , yoga, five-animal exercises help to keep the balance of internal organs; other modern exercises help to maintain a healthy weight and keep a good body shape. MyChi gives you advice on exercise options, tailored for you.

Feel uncomfortable? With MyChi, you can change to Symptom Management Guide mode. By Food Therapy, acupressure and exercise techniques it helps to alleviate common ailments.

At the end of the day MyChi shows you what you’ve done and what you haven’t done for the day according to MyChi’s advice. Meanwhile you enjoy talking with friends in MyChi community, showing off your achievement.



How Does MyChi Work


MyChi deploys a synthesis of new and old techniques to help you with your diet and sleep.  Upon collecting data from your sleep rhythms, the MyChi app analyzes your patterns with the Sleep Quality Model, developed over the course of 10 years by the Beijing TCM Research Center, using Meridian Organ Clock Theory*.  Combined with other health data, this helps the app pinpoint potential weaknesses in your body.  The app can then provide optimized Food Therapy, exercise and acupressure recommendations to improve organ functioning and re-establish balance within your body.  After following these simple suggestions, you can expect increased energy, improved sleep, and overall better health.

*Meridian Organ Clock Theory is used in acupuncture practice. Some people call it the Body Clock system. It’s a natural law that models the movement of energy patterns, qi flow and blood flow, throughout body.  According to Traditional Chinese Medicine practices, within each 24 hour cycle, each 2 hour period is related to an organ network. From 1am to 3am, for example, is connected to the liver organ network. If you always wake up (or don’t sleep) during this period of time, it indicates that your liver network is in need of adjustment.  This theory is used for both diagnosis and treatment of organ network weakness in TCM.


Perks





Risks and Challenge

Perhaps the biggest challenge we face in bringing this product to market is communicating the principles and benefits of Traditional Chinese Food Therapy to consumers who are new to these concepts. To tackle this challenge, we integrated TCFT with Western nutrition standards, included many Western foods and recipes, and developed intuitive, user-friendly meal plans and tips. 

We are driven by a desire to introduce these simple benefits to a larger audience.  We believe the market is mature and looking for integrative health solutions.  It is both a challenge and a unique opportunity to pioneer the integration of ancient Eastern wisdom with modern Western science in personal consumer health technology. 


Production Timeline:





About Traditional Chinese Food Therapy and Our Story

Traditional Chinese Food therapy, or TCFT, is a holistic philosophy system with ancient roots in China.  Sharing many aspects with Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), it has benefitted Chinese people for thousands of years. TCFT is a holistic system of selecting the best nourishment for your body based on your specific body type and condition, the attributes of specific foods and seasonings, and matching those with seasonal factors.  TCFT assesses and combines this diverse range of variables to design a regimen that supports the immune system, aides sleep and digestion, and helps you maintain a healthy weight in harmony with your body’s natural rhythms.

MyChi is a convenient tool that transforms the intricate process of living according to TCFT principles, into something that’s easy and fun for you to use. It’s like having your own dedicated holistic life coach trained to understand your body’s needs and working to give you tailored advice, every day, right from your smart phone!

Our team became interested in developing the MyChi system after experiencing the dramatic impact that Traditional Chinese Food Therapy had in our own lives.

Sophia Ma (the founder) happily became a mother in 2012.  During her recuperation period, Sophia closely designed her recovery regimen according to TCFT.  She was amazed at her speedy recovery and quickly regained the strength she needed to meet the demands of motherhood.

Inspired by her own experience, she decided she had to find a way to share the powerful principles of TCFT with a larger audience.

Anna Na (co-founder) encountered serious health problems brought on by the stresses of her busy professional lifestyle eight years ago.  After a series of attempted and failed remedies, she healed with the help of Traditional Chinese Medicine which kicked off her deep and lasting engagement with Traditional Chinese Food Therapy and its applications. 

While only a qualified doctor can treat with herbal medicines and other TCM techniques, with the right knowledge and tools, it is possible for anyone to apply the principles of TCFT to their daily lives.

Our Team

                         




Our Design Mission

Holistic design is the guiding principle of the MyChi, in both hardware and software.  A big advantage of MyChi above most other modern personal assessment tools is that the MyChi system does not just deliver cold hard data without analysis, but instead offers simple and actionable holistic advice that has the potential to transform your health.  The design of the MyChi Pebble is inspired by traditional elements of Chinese health culture, jade and BianShi, for a natural, ergonomic feel.  Jade calms the mind for sleep, and Bianshi is a wellness tool widely used in ancient China.  Its design reflects Traditional Chinese Medicine’s concept of the harmonic balance between human and nature.


MyChi was designed not only to be beautiful outside. The structure finely protects the chip and battery inside.


How Did We Get Here

For almost one year, we’ve been designing, coding, building, testing, breaking, re-coding, re-testing, and redesigning. Now we finally have our prototype MyChi Pebble ready for use.

1. Coding


2. Welding&building 


3.  Testing



Who is Mychi for?

MyChi is a holistic personal smart assistant suitable for those who seek balance within their bodies through increasing mindfulness of what they consume, how they sleep, and how they live day-to-day according to TCFT teachings.
According to World Health Organization (WHO), one-third of the world’s people suffer sleep problems. Sleeplessness has many nebulous effects which could include emotional problems, depression, anxiety, and tension, and may cause hypertension and diabetes. People with sleep problems are at 2-3 times greater risk of heart disease than people who sleep well. Those who suffer chronic sleep loss (insomnia) tend to have a shorter lifespan.

Many people don’t realize that their mental and physical issues are caused by insufficient sleep or low quality sleep. And they don’t realize they can improve sleep by eating the right foods and making small changes in their daily lives. MyChi makes these connections for you, making it simple to live a better life!


We Need Your Help

Achieving our pledge goal means more people will have the opportunity to improve their health through MyChi.

We already have first prototypes of the device ready to go.  By meeting our Indiegogo goals, we’ll order the first production batch of the device and put the finishing touches on our mobile application. Our early adopters on Indiegogo will get the first chance to see the results from this revolutionary system. 

In the meantime we hope to gain your valuable feedback during the initial phases of production. We need your insights so that we are sure to make a product that fulfills all of your needs.



Spread the Word!

We’d love it if you’d consider backing our campaign.  And if you have friends who are interested in emerging technology, holistic care, healthy eating, or Eastern medicine/TCM please let them know about our work here.  Let’s start a holistic health journey together!

                                                                                 FAQ

About MyChi Pebble

  • What does the MyChi Pebble look like?

The MyChi Pebble is very beautiful and about the size of a large coin, like a piece of jade. It took two years for the top designers to complete it. The outside shape references Bian Shi, a special thin stone that was used as scraping tool in ancient Chinese medicine treatment. Combined with a modern design, the device looks like a piece of art.

  • What about the quality of the MyChi Pebble?
The important part of the MyChi Pebble is the inside sensor. The sensor chip is made by the top manufacturer in China and they have a solid track record of experience with many widely sold, well-known smart devices.

  • Can two people or a family use one MyChi?
No. To make the data accurate, one MyChi system is needed for each individual.

  • How often do I need to change the battery?
You do not need to change the battery. The internal battery will last approximately 12 months. At that time, you will be able to return the device in exchange for a new one at a discounted rate.

About Delivery

  • How much does it cost?

It's US$129 per MyChi system, but you can get it at about 50% discount during Indiegogo campaign.

  • When will you deliver the product?
We plan to deliver our first batch of products in April, 2016.


About MyChi App

  • Is the app available for Android and iPhone?
The App will be available for iPhone only after completion of our Indiegogo campaign. In the future, we will work to develop an Android app as well.

  • What if I’m a Gluten-free or a vegetarian user?

We plan to develop a separate version for vegetarian and gluten free users later.

However, if you are a vegetarian and want to use the earlier MyChi version, you can replace meat with vegetarian food. The foods recommended are whole foods with high nutritional value. Meat is only a small part of the meal plan.

  • What if I have special nutritional needs or allergies? (allergies, restricted diet, medical condition)

All foods recommended in the MyChi app are real healthy whole foods that provide optimal health and are especially useful for people with many medical conditions. You can also eliminate/substitute foods if you have specific allergies. However, you should consult your physician or dietitian before following the MyChi app’s advice.

  • Will all the foods be available to me in my local supermarket?

Most foods will be available in local supermarkets or local Asian shops. For special foods such as dried black fungus, we have a link guide to online shops such as amazon.com.

  • Does the app recommend snacks as well as meals?

Yes, the app recommends the full meal plan for a whole day including snack and drinks. One day’s menu includes drinks, breakfast, morning snack, lunch, afternoon snack, and dinner. Most snacks recommended are fruits and vegetables.

  • What type of time does it take to cook/prepare the meals?

Most of the foods take less than 30 minutes to prepare. A few therapeutic foods such as congee and soup will take longer, although they’re simple to prepare.

You can find most of the lunch foods easily in restaurants, making it convenient for busy working people.

  • I get treatment from a TCM doctor (or get acupuncture). How does this work with the treatment I am receiving?

Chinese Food Therapy is complementary to other TCM treatment. However, you should consult your TCM doctor before following MyChi’s advice.

tells your sleep status, but also analyzes your sleep patterns, finds the

MyChi app analyzes your patterns with the Sleep Quality Model, developed
 over the course of 10 years by the Beijing TCM Research Center, using 
Meridian Organ Clock Theory*.  Combined with other health data, this 
helps the app pinpoint potential weaknesses in your body.  The app can 
then provide optimized Food Therapy, exercise and acupressure 
recommendations to improve organ functioning and re-establish balance 
within your body.  After following these simple suggestions, you can 
expect increased energy, improved sleep, and overall better health.

*Meridian Organ Clock Theory is used in acupuncture practice. 
Some people call it the Body Clock system. It’s a natural law that 
models the movement of energy patterns, qi flow and blood flow, 
throughout body.  According to Traditional Chinese Medicine practices, 
within each 24 hour cycle, each 2 hour period is related to an organ 
network. From 1am to 3am, for example, is connected to the liver organ 
network. If you always wake up (or don’t sleep) during this period of 
time, it indicates that your liver network is in need of adjustment.  
This theory is used for both diagnosis and treatment of organ network 
weakness in TCM.


Perks











Risks and Challenge
Perhaps the biggest challenge we face in bringing this product to 
market is communicating the principles and benefits of Traditional 
Chinese Food Therapy to consumers who are new to these concepts. To 
tackle this challenge, we integrated TCFT with Western nutrition 
standards, included many Western foods and recipes, and developed 
intuitive, user-friendly meal plans and tips. 
We are driven by a desire to introduce these simple benefits to a 
larger audience.  We believe the market is mature and looking for 
integrative health solutions.  It is both a challenge and a unique 
opportunity to pioneer the integration of ancient Eastern wisdom with 
modern Western science in personal consumer health technology.  


Production Timeline:












About Traditional Chinese Food Therapy and Our Story
Traditional Chinese Food therapy, or TCFT, is a holistic philosophy 
system with ancient roots in China.  Sharing many aspects with 
Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM), it has benefitted Chinese people for
 thousands of years. TCFT is a holistic system of selecting the best 
nourishment for your body based on your specific body type and 
condition, the attributes of specific foods and seasonings, and matching
 those with seasonal factors.  TCFT assesses and combines this diverse 
range of variables to design a regimen that supports the immune system, 
aides sleep and digestion, and helps you maintain a healthy weight in 
harmony with your body’s natural rhythms.
MyChi is a convenient tool that transforms the intricate process of 
living according to TCFT principles, into something that’s easy and fun 
for you to use. It’s like having your own dedicated holistic life coach 
trained to understand your body’s needs and working to give you tailored
 advice, every day, right from your smart phone!
Our team became interested in developing the MyChi system after 
experiencing the dramatic impact that Traditional Chinese Food Therapy 
had in our own lives.
Sophia Ma (the founder) happily became a mother in 2012.  During her 
recuperation period, Sophia closely designed her recovery regimen 
according to TCFT.  She was amazed at her speedy recovery and quickly 
regained the strength she needed to meet the demands of motherhood.
Inspired by her own experience, she decided she had to find a way to 
share the powerful principles of TCFT with a larger audience.
Anna Na (co-founder) encountered serious health problems brought on 
by the stresses of her busy professional lifestyle eight years ago.  
After a series of attempted and failed remedies, she healed with the 
help of Traditional Chinese Medicine which kicked off her deep and 
lasting engagement with Traditional Chinese Food Therapy and its 
applications. 
While only a qualified doctor can treat with herbal medicines and 
other TCM techniques, with the right knowledge and tools, it is possible
 for anyone to apply the principles of TCFT to their daily lives.
Our Team






                         


Our Design Mission

Holistic design is the guiding principle of the MyChi, in both hardware and software.  A big advantage of MyChi above most other modern personal assessment tools is that the MyChi system does not just deliver cold hard data without analysis, but instead offers simple and actionable holistic advice that has the potential to transform your health.  The design of the MyChi Pebble is inspired by traditional elements of Chinese health culture, jade and BianShi, for a natural, ergonomic feel.  Jade calms the mind for sleep, and Bianshi is a wellness tool widely used in ancient China.  Its design reflects Traditional Chinese Medicine’s concept of the harmonic balance between human and nature.



MyChi was designed not only to be
beautiful outside. The structure finely protects the chip and battery inside.








How Did We Get Here
For almost one year, we’ve been designing, coding, building, testing, breaking, re-coding, re-testing, and redesigning. Now we finally have our prototype MyChi Pebble ready for use.1. Coding


2. Welding&building 




3.  Testing







Who is Mychi for?
MyChi is a holistic personal smart assistant suitable for those who seek balance within their bodies through increasing mindfulness of what they consume, how they sleep, and how they live day-to-day according to TCFT teachings.
According to World Health Organization (WHO), one-third of the world’s people suffer sleep problems. Sleeplessness has many nebulous effects which could include emotional problems, depression, anxiety, and tension, and may cause hypertension and diabetes. People with sleep problems are at 2-3 times greater risk of heart disease than people who sleep well. Those who suffer chronic sleep loss (insomnia) tend to have a shorter lifespan.
Many people don’t realize that their mental and physical issues are caused by insufficient sleep or low quality sleep. And they don’t realize they can improve sleep by eating the right foods and making small changes in their daily lives. MyChi makes these connections for you, making it simple to live a better life!

We Need Your Help






Achieving our pledge goal means more people will have the opportunity to improve their health through MyChi.
We already have first prototypes of the device ready to go.  By meeting our Indiegogo goals, we’ll order the first production batch of the device and put the finishing touches on our mobile application. Our early adopters on Indiegogo will get the first chance to see the results from this revolutionary system. 
In the meantime we hope to gain your valuable feedback during the initial phases of production. We need your insights so that we are sure to make a product that fulfills all of your needs.



Spread the Word!





We’d love it if you’d consider backing our campaign.  And if you have friends who are interested in emerging technology, holistic care, healthy eating, or Eastern medicine/TCM please let them know about our work here.  Let’s start a holistic health journey together!


                                                                                 FAQ
About MyChi Pebble



What does the MyChi Pebble look like?


The MyChi Pebble is very beautiful and about the size of a large coin, like a piece of jade. It took two years for the top designers to complete it. The outside shape references Bian Shi, a special thin stone that was used as scraping tool in ancient Chinese medicine treatment. Combined with a modern design, the device looks like a piece of art.


What about the quality of the MyChi Pebble?
The important part of the MyChi Pebble is the inside sensor. The sensor chip is made by the top manufacturer in China and they have a solid track record of experience with many widely sold, well-known smart devices.Can two people or a family use one MyChi?

No. To make the data accurate, one MyChi system is needed for each individual.
How often do I need to change the battery?


You do not need to change the battery. The internal battery will last approximately 12 months. At that time, you will be able to return the device in exchange for a new one at a discounted rate. About DeliveryHow much does it cost?
It's US$129 per MyChi system, but you can get it at about 50% discount during Indiegogo campaign. When will you deliver the product?
We plan to deliver our first batch of products in April, 2016.


About MyChi App

Is the app available for Android and iPhone?
The App will be available for iPhone only after completion of our Indiegogo campaign. In the future, we will work to develop an Android app as well.
What if I’m a Gluten-free or a vegetarian user?
We plan to develop a separate version for vegetarian and gluten free users later.

However, if you are a vegetarian and want to use the earlier MyChi version, you can replace meat with vegetarian food. The foods recommended are whole foods with high nutritional value. Meat is only a small part of the meal plan. 
What if I have special nutritional needs or allergies? (allergies, restricted diet, medical condition)
All foods recommended in the MyChi app are real healthy whole foods that provide optimal health and are especially useful for people with many medical conditions. You can also eliminate/substitute foods if you have specific allergies. However, you should consult your physician or dietitian before following the MyChi app’s advice.
Will all the foods be available to me in my local supermarket?
Most foods will be available in local supermarkets or local Asian shops. For special foods such as dried black fungus, we have a link guide to online shops such as amazon.com.
Does the app recommend snacks as well as meals? 
Yes, the app recommends the full meal plan for a whole day including snack and drinks. One day’s menu includes drinks, breakfast, morning snack, lunch, afternoon snack, and dinner. Most snacks recommended are fruits and vegetables.
What type of time does it take to cook/prepare the meals?
Most of the foods take less than 30 minutes to prepare. A few therapeutic foods such as congee and soup will take longer, although they’re simple to prepare. 

You can find most of the lunch foods easily in restaurants, making it convenient for busy working people.
I get treatment from a TCM doctor (or get acupuncture). How does this work with the treatment I am receiving?
Chinese Food Therapy is complementary to other TCM treatment. However, you should consult your TCM doctor before following MyChi’s advice.

story:
Father Christian Villagomeza invites you to help demonstrate Christian Values in a very active way. We started with a program through Gospel Food Ministries to supply needy families with quality foods one time per month. We added a program where we pick up donated bread and pastry items 2 days per week. We recently expanded our program to include canned and boxed foods through the Premium Product Program of Feeding America and we would like to significantly expand our community outreach with other fresh food products. To accomplish this expansion we need to do some renovation of our existing building to include at least 2-3 freezers, 2-3 more refrigerators, locking doors in the food storage area, repainting, a monitored security system that covers the food storage area and the church, add additional storage facilities and any additional upgrades to meet current building codes. We are planning extensive marketing into the community about our food/pantry programs - in part through the "Every Door" program available through the Postal Service and in addition through mailings completed through the use of "Amazing Mail" that works along with the U.S. Postal System.  The "more expansive" program available through Feeding America, requires many of these upgrades and we are presently on their list for this more complete program when it becomes available to us and when we have fully met the requirements.

     Note: Our Diocese has also given us some seed money (Oct. 17) in the amount of $3,000. This demonstrates support toward our goal and it also demonstrates to potential donors that there is support from our own Christian Fellowship.

     Some of the money collected will be used to purchase the CD (Perk), mailing fees and any other related fees. A CD (Ben Pila -Commemoration) will be given away as a perk to those donating $60.00 or more. We are extremely fortunate to be able to offer this CD which is already produced by Ben Pila, the classical guitarist that just recently played for the Pope during his visit to the United States .

     We are also planning to work with Ben in the production of a Classical Guitar Christmas CD that will be available next year. Although there was not enough time to get that CD produced for this campaign, it will be available next year in advance of the Christmas Holiday. Those donating $100.00 or more will get that CD next year. before December 10th along with the CD that he has available now.  The CD available now will be shipped at the conclusion of this campaign to those contributing $60. Some of the funds collected will be used to make the Classical Christmas Holiday CD for next year.

     We will use one of the best recording studios in the country and one of the best CD production services and one of the best CD production and mastering services available.

     We will also use a local independent certified accountant to track all money received and how all funds are spent. This information will be available to anyone upon request via email. We are going to provide step-by-step documentation of our program so that it can become "repeatable" at other churches of any faith or other groups that may want the information.

     Dr. B. Neumeier, professor of "Computer Education", an active church member, will spearhead the program development, documentation and implementation along with other members of the fellowship.
