story:
What is eyeDOcare

Eye Do Care is a campaign aiming to raise awareness and generate funds towards an eye tumor disease in India. This typical disease is called Ocular Adnexal Lymphoma (OAL). 


The Impact


Your valuable support will enable to generate the awareness and share the knowledge of the disease among the general public, this will be extremely helpful as this particular disease is considered rare in the Indian medical literature. With your generous contribution, 20 patients in need will receive a proper diagnosis, which they cannot afford. Further, the data from the diagnosis of these 20 patients will be used to conduct an in-depth research. This would reduce many people's sufferings in India. 

How will the money be used?

£3,000 will be used to provide free diagnosis to 20 patients in need. This would also further the study on the disease.



The team @Google Campus London
Further details about the Research Project...

The research project

The aim of the research project is not to find the treatment but a more efficient and an affordable diagnosis. The complexity of the diagnosis lies in the various subtypes of the disease. Some subtypes may be treated with antibiotics if the cause of the disease is understood, while some require more sophisticated radiotherapy or chemotherapy. A proper diagnosis would enable the doctors to decide on the right treatment and improve the patients’ quality of life. 

Lead researcher 

Dr. Ruchi Mittal is an ocular pathologist working for a non-profit organization, L.V .Prasad Eye Institute, in India. She is the leading doctor of the institute, with a strong responsibility to provide correct diagnoses to her patients.

Extended Funding

To support a one year project on studying the cause of the disease, the team would need a total funding of £ 10, 000. 


More information on the disease and the head researcher at http://eyedocare.weebly.com/

story:
What is the Proper Pillow Plus?

Quantifying your sleep with the Proper Pillow Plus allows you to analyze your sleep behavior, and make the necessary changes in order to get a better night's sleep.  

"We are living in the Age of Quantification, monitoring in our waking lives.  The next logical step is the accurate quantification of how we sleep, with the goal of improving our waking lives through improved sleep.  Existing quantification tools do not live up to the promise of improving sleep wellness." - Dr. Rick Loos, inventor of Proper Pillow 


The Sleep Enthusiast's dream.....

The Proper Pillow Plus is not only an orthopedic pillow designed to support optimal alignment, but also a revolutionary sleep tool to quantify your sleep behavior.  We already analyze the majority of our waking activities.  But what about sleep?    



Why do YOU need the Proper Pillow Plus?

What if you are waking up tired and lethargic?  And what if your pillow could tell you why?  Sleep is SO important.  You sleep for 1/3 of your life, and your quality of sleep profoundly effects the 2/3 of life you spend awake.  Attention, energy and productivity are all directly  effected by your quality of sleep.  

Certain positions can cause sleep interruptions such as 

  • difficulty breathing
  • snoring
  • tossing & turning
These patterns could be due to your sleep position blocking the airway, or other factors.  You may even learn that your sleep environment is a huge factor preventing you from gaining restful sleep!

Here's how it works: 

 By embedding the monitoring technology into the pillow itself, we are bringing the power of quantification into the heart of the sleep experience.   Integrating a sensor network of pressure receptors, audio and thermal into the skeleton of the pillow your sleep experience will relay directly to the Proper Pillow Plus app on your smartphone or tablet via low energy Bluetooth.  This information will be converted into easy to read graphs and percentages that include how long and what positions you slept in, the ambient room temperature, breathing patterns, and if your sleep cycle was interrupted.  The data will compound over time allowing you to clearly understand your behavior and modify it.   




How do you use the app?

You will be able to control when the data will transfer to your smartphone.   Your data will sync seamlessly to the app.  Once you wake up, tap the app and all your statistics will appear! It's THAT simple!

With your help, we can make it happen.  Check out our perks and help us help you! 

We can't thank you enough for your support so far! Let's finish this!!!

 Shipping

Shipping can get pretty complicated and tends to fluctuate, so in order to be as fair as we can we will contact you closer to the shipping date to arrange shipping costs.

We appreciate your patience! 

FAQ:

  1. Why is there a hole in the center of the pillow? --The hole in the middle is part of the design features of the original Proper Pillow.  This design works perfectly with the Plus version due to the orthopedic alignment provided with both back and side sleeping positions the pillow offers.
  2. What material is the pillow made of?--The Proper Pillow Plus has three separate layers, each made up of different materials.  The first layer is a proprietary low density memory foam blend.  This is where the receptors will lie.  The second layer is a polyester blend designed to prevent heat transfer, so your pillow will stay cool at night.  No more pillow flipping!  The third layer is a hygienic cotton cover that is machine washable.  
  3. Is the Very Low Energy Blue Tooth Safe? -The pillow acts as a passive receptor field that will gather data throughout the night.  This data will then be "dumped" via the low energy blue tooth to your smart phone/tablet at a time that You establish!  Very Low Energy Blue Tooth is a phenomenal vehicle for transporting data due to its low output power. In fact, is so low, the FCC does not require them to be tested for Specific Absorption Rate (SAR), a measure of the rate at which energy is absorbed by the human body when exposed to RF radiation, including microwave radiation). Cellphones and laptops, on the other hand, must pass strict SAR testing requirements, since they operate at higher power levels.

Disclaimer

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 

Paypal requires the above disclaimer, but we promise we will work our hardest until we have fulfilled every perk!

These patterns could be due to your sleep position blocking the airway, or other factors.  You may even learn that your sleep environment is a huge factor preventing you from gaining restful sleep!

Here's how it works: 
 By embedding the monitoring technology into the pillow itself, we are bringing the power of quantification into the heart of the sleep experience.   Integrating a sensor network of pressure receptors, audio and thermal into the skeleton of the pillow your sleep experience will relay directly to the Proper Pillow Plus app on your smartphone or tablet via low energy Bluetooth.  This information will be converted into easy to read graphs and percentages that include how long and what positions you slept in, the ambient room temperature, breathing patterns, and if your sleep cycle was interrupted.  The data will compound over time allowing you to clearly understand your behavior and modify it.   





How do you use the app?
You will be able to control when the data will transfer to your smartphone.   Your data will sync seamlessly to the app.  Once you wake up, tap the app and all your statistics will appear! It's THAT simple!
With your help, we can make it happen.  Check out our perks and help us help you! 
We can't thank you enough for your support so far! Let's finish this!!!
 Shipping
Shipping can get pretty complicated and tends to fluctuate, so in order to be as fair as we can we will contact you closer to the shipping date to arrange shipping costs.

We appreciate your patience! 
FAQ:



Why is there a hole in the center of the pillow? --The hole in the middle is part of the design features of the original Proper Pillow.  This design works perfectly with the Plus version due to the orthopedic alignment provided with both back and side sleeping positions the pillow offers.

What material is the pillow made of?--The Proper Pillow Plus has three separate layers, each made up of different materials.  The first layer is a proprietary low density memory foam blend.  This is where the receptors will lie.  The second layer is a polyester blend designed to prevent heat transfer, so your pillow will stay cool at night.  No more pillow flipping!  The third layer is a hygienic cotton cover that is machine washable.  

Is the Very Low Energy Blue Tooth Safe? -The pillow acts as a passive receptor field that will gather data throughout the night.  This data will then be "dumped" via the low energy blue tooth to your smart phone/tablet at a time that You establish!  Very Low Energy Blue Tooth is a phenomenal vehicle for transporting data due to its low output power. In fact, is so low, the FCC does not require them to be tested for Specific Absorption Rate (SAR), a measure of the rate at which energy is absorbed by the human body when exposed to RF radiation, including microwave radiation). Cellphones and laptops, on the other hand, must pass strict SAR testing requirements, since they operate at higher power levels.




Disclaimer
"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed." 
Paypal requires the above disclaimer, but we promise we will work our hardest until we have fulfilled every perk!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Jessica Schneider. I am seeking financial help in attending the National Fibromyalgia and Chronic Pain Association's 2015 Treating and Preventing Chronic Pain Conference on October 8-10. I am excited to hear directly from experts on subjects like orofacial pain, the use of polysomnography (sleep study) as a tool in managing chronic pain, alternatives to opioid medications for the treatment of pain, and myofascial pain self-management. (That's just part of day one! You can view the full conference schedule at: http://www.paintap.org/program-speakers/ )

I am one of the 100 million Americans who suffers from chronic pain. I've had unrelenting chronic pain and muscle spasms since 2004.  After receiving a diagnosis of Fibromyalgia in 2005, I had a lot of questions. The pain I was experiencing at the time was not under control by any definition. I was depressed. My weight went up with nearly every new medication I was given. I was suffering from anxiety attacks that made daily living even harder. Medication side effects essentially doubled the number of symptoms I had to cope with. 

My life changed again in 2006 when I went to an online forum for people recently diagnosed with a chronic pain disease, and I learned that I really wasn't losing my mind- I was “just” grieving … and being forced through insurance step-therapy. While many of the tools and techniques I still use today to manage my pain came from exam rooms, others came to me as the direct result of talking to other patients. Before I was able to truly fight back at the pain that had stolen my life away, I first had to understand what I was fighting. I also needed to understand how to use the tools at my disposal, and that again, is where support groups helped me tremendously. This gave me purpose, and that purpose gave me resiliency to keep looking for a better way forward.

In 2011, I started a Fibromyalgia support group in the Tucson metro area. To date, we have approximately 200 members, many of whom are active in our online community and/or at face-to-face events in town. We meet 12-14 times per year. The purpose of this group is to help provide patients with a way to create a support network for themselves. It is a place to share information, give encouragement, and ask questions.  This is the first time I have asked for any significant financial contributions for or from this group, in any way. (We don't even charge membership dues.) 

Today, my symptoms are relatively well-controlled. I understand how to travel long distances while minimizing fluctuations in symptoms caused by travel itself.


What We Need & What You Get

All money raised through this platform will immediately go towards cost associated with attending this conference, detailed below:

$265 - Conference fee (by early bird deadline of 9/1)

($135/night) x 4 nights = $540 - Hotel 

$450 - Airfare (round trip)

$60- Misc fees for hotel, airfare, or unforeseen transportation needs

Total estimated cost: $1,315

Why four nights in a hotel for a 2-day conference?

One of the techniques that many support group leaders teach is called pacing. Pacing encourages pain patients to slow down- don't do everything at once!  Pacing encourages patients to work within physical limitations to prevent further injury or pain, which can sometimes last for weeks. This extra day will give me the opportunity to organize my notes and conference materials while giving my body a short respite before travelling home after a very busy long weekend. Since Friday's conference day starts at 9am and I am flying to DCA from Tucson, I will need to fly into DCA on Thursday no matter what!


While I'm at the conference:

  • I'll ask your questions to the experts if I have the opportunity
  •  Updates throughout the conference via Facebook and the web at www.azfibro.com 


When I return from this conference, I will host a series of "debriefing" events during the fall and winter months for my local Fibromyalgia support group. I’ll also provide informational packets for attendees.

These hard-copy handouts will include:

  • Hard copies of any conference materials that I bring home
  • Summaries of each conference session
  • Q & A session for our group to cover anything I may have missed


All funds that are raised through this platform will go towards hotel fees, airfare, and conference fees. Any excess money raised will be donated to the NFMCPA, a registered non-profit that works to create better quality of life for pain patients through education and advocacy.


The Impact

Many pain patients are unable to travel for conferences like this one. Inability to miss days at work, inability to travel (period), or the inability to pay are common barriers. Funding my trip doesn't just help me- it helps pain patients everywhere learn how to manage their conditions more effectively. This trip will give me a tremendous opportunity to network with other support group leaders, as well.

People who suffer from chronic, non-terminal conditions tend to have a better prognosis when they are well-informed about their health. Although Fibromyalgia is one of the least funded diseases in the US, researchers continue to make forward movement on more effective treatments and a deeper understanding of chronic pain. Medical journals are often behind paywalls, which many patients cannot afford. Why read about treatment updates in a journal when I can potentially hear it straight from the source?

Please help me reach my goal so that I can continue to help other people take back their lives from unrelenting, poorly managed, chronic pain and return to happier, more productive lives.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, here’s how you can still help:

  • Share this campaign on social media
  • Help with copying and informational packet assembly when I return
  • Share my conference updates to other patients (Oct 8-10) in an effort to provide patients with relevant information about managing chronic pain

Thank you for your support!

story:
Our Mission

Since its birth in 2012, inBalance has been changing the fitness and wellness community in the Texas Hill Country.  We wanted to provide a space where you can find balance in life - we not only teach yoga, pilates, barre and fitness classes, we also provide a sense of community and belonging, and help our students achieve personal growth.   Class sizes are kept small, to ensure that maximum attention is paid to each student in class.   inBalance knows their clients, their history of injury, restrictions, and limitations to ensure each class is a personal experience for every student, providing maximum safety with optimal results.  We set up with the mission of offering a peaceful space where beginners and experts can come to enjoy a range of classes and train in different styles of movement in an intimate atmosphere. We know that the intimate, stress-free atmosphere we offer is hard to find in large gyms and fitness centers. 

What We Need & What You Get

Since opening our doors in 2012, we have been steadily growing our inBalance family and expanding the way we provide fitness and wellness for them.  This has been a long and arduous process for all of our instructors and staff at inBalance, including countless hours of education and certification courses to enhance our already knowledgeable staff,  carefully planned budgeting to prepare for a persistently growing family of members, and limitless days spent meticulously planning each days' schedule to maximize the use of time and space in order to create a schedule that meets the needs of our members.  The last three months were spent completing our expansion and renovation into a larger space, and we have so much more in store for all of you!

So in order to complete the next stage of our growth, we are calling on our members and supporters for help.  With the $15,000 we’re aiming to raise, we are buying equipment and props to take our Barre, Pilates, HIIT/bootcamp and yoga classes to an even higher level of fitness.  These additions to our classes mean all of us at inBalance get the pleasure of keeping those muscles screaming, butts burning, legs shaking, and floors soaked with your sweat...

He's a breakdown of where the funds will go from this campaign:


*pilates equipment (20%) 

*Barre and HIIT/bootcamp equipment (20%)

*yoga props/equipment (10%)

*other build out  material (mirrors, floors, sound system, etc) (50%)


As appreciation for your contribution, we've offered some legitimate rewards in exchange for your hard earned contributions. We're offering some amazing perks for your support; including reformer class passes, free classes for a year, and private group sessions for you and your friends! Take a look:

$25: Receive 2 free late cancels!

$100: 3 drop in classes (group fitness/wellness class) OR give them to a friend for the holidays!

$200: VIP membership for a year   

$350: 1 month of unlimited group fitness/wellness classes PLUS 1 private sessions (of your choice)

$500- 5 private sessions (session of your choice). PLUS you will receive an exclusive inBalance Ambassador t-shirt and your name on our website. 

$1000- 3 months of unlimited classes, as well as 3 small group session for you and some friends (session of your choice!), or 5 sessions just for you. PLUS you will receive an exclusive inBalance Ambassador t-shirt and your name on our website. 

$2000- Free group classes for a year, and a VIP membership! This includes all groups classes (yoga, pilates, barre, HIIT, cardio) and all the perks of being a VIP member. PLUS you will receive an exclusive inBalance Ambassador t-shirt and your name on our website. 

$3000+ -  ALL group fitness/wellness classes for a year! This includes all groups classes (yoga, pilates, barre, HIIT, cardio) PLUS 4 reformer/equipment classes per month for an entire YEAR! You also receive the VIP membership. You will receive an exclusive inBalance Ambassador t-shirt and your name on our website. 

Our Story

Hope Cowgill Pedraza, owner and founder of inBalance,  created this space in 2012 to provide a place for all the mind body exercises to come together in one place.  

The goal: the give people options and provide the best possible experience, one not found anywhere else in town.  She believes that boutique style studios like inBalance are the wave of the future.  It is her mission to make everyone who walks in the door to become the best version of themselves,  to inspire and nurture the body, physically and spiritually, and to provide a sense of belonging and community with students, that you don’t get in those large group exercise class at big name gyms and fitness clubs. 

Hope also believes small businesses like hers create jobs and are the true driver of local economies, brining communities closer together.  To make this happen, we’re going to need your help.  Whether through direct contributions to our campaign or from spreading the word, it takes a supportive community to make any business successful.   At inBalance we’re here to share our passion for fitness and wellness with you- please help us succeed by putting whatever contribution that you feel led to make, whether it’s $10 or $1000…every little bit gets us closer to our dream!

The Impact

While any number of factors drive people through the doors of inBalance, there is really just one reason they keep coming back: because being there feels good! The goal at inBalance is not to create a fad dedicated to fitness, but a lifestyle.  One that exhibits a love of movement and prides itself on connecting the mind, body and spirit.   

Classes at inBalance rely on a range of proven methods to take you out of your comfort zone, strengthen your body, and improve flexibility, with a balance on a focused and fun approach to movement.  With your contributions, we plan to work even harder to provide you a unique experience, one where you find a sense of community and find a sense of fulfillment, not just physically but mentally and emotionally with our community of followers and top notch instructors.

Ways You Can Help

Pick a perk and wear inBalance with pride OR give us a shout out and share what we’re up to with your community. Word of mouth is endlessly powerful and it’s how we got our start. The more chatter, the better. If you’re strapped for cash, no worries! Follow us on Social media to learn about free community classes hosted by inBalance.  Sharing our mission on your favorite flavor of social media, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Google+, YouTube, etc. helps us out as well! 

Follow us on Twitter: @inbalancesa 

Give us a double tap on Instagram: @inbalancesa

Like what you see on Facebook: inBalance San Antonio

Thanks for reading and supporting inBalance, and we look forward to seeing you on the mat very soon!

story:
This is Third Eye Insight, Fitness for the Blind, in action - teaching the blind and visually impaired to surf. This is just one of the Fitness Field Trips that TEI hosts year-round to encourage its members to get fit, expand their horizons and stretch their limits. Help us fund our Fitness Field Trips for the visually impaired community. Everyone should get the opportunity to play outside!

The BackStory

Third Eye Insight, Fitness for the Blind, provides free martial arts, yoga and meditation classes for the blind and visually impaired. Our mission is to improve the health and well-being of the visually impaired community through sport and play.

Our founder, Sensei Devin Fernandez, was diagnosed in 2000 with retinitis pigmentosa, a degenerative eye disease that results in blindness. As he wrestled with the implications of the disease and began to navigate his way through social services for the blind, he discovered a lack of physical activities that engaged this underserved community, of which he was now a part. Driven by a desire to integrate his martial arts, yoga and meditation expertise and experience with the gift of service, he, along with his sister Kim Fernandez, launched Third Eye Insight in May 2010. The essence of the program is simple, yet exerts powerful, rippling effects for our students and the community. We have recently caught the attention of local reporters at Fox News who put together this piece on Third Eye Insight.

Fitness Field Trips

Our campaign is simple: We want our TEI participants to get out and play! In addition to our weekly 'inside activities' – martial arts, yoga and meditation classes, we host monthly outdoor activities including surfing, kayaking, horseback riding and rock climbing, among others. These Fitness Field Trips provide a challenging, yet safe and supportive environment, for participants to expand their definitions of what their bodies and minds can do. It's a physically and mentally empowering experience for all involved. This campaign will allow more of the visually impaired community to take part in these events by decreasing our overhead costs.

Our first Fitness Field Trip of the summer is one short month away, when we host our very first Tandem Bike Ride at Heckscher State Park in East Islip, Long Island, on June 27. We are partnering with InTandem, who will provide the bikes. Volunteer captains will help ferry our TEI participants in and around the park. 


How you can help!

Help us get TEI members on to surfboards, horse saddles, kayaks and bicycles! The $1,000 funding we receive will go directly to the Fitness Field Trip Program to pay for instruction for each monthly activity, equipment rental or purchase, lunches and travel expenses (getting participants to and fro). Thank you!
